meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p10

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: This type of sign warns you of hazards ahead. Make sure you look at each sign and road marking that you pass, so that you don't miss any vital instructions or information. This sign shows there's a T-junction with priority over vehicles from the right.

incorrect.text: This type of sign warns you of hazards ahead. Make sure you look at each sign and road marking that you pass, so that you don't miss any vital instructions or information. This sign shows there's a T-junction with priority over vehicles from the right.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p134, KYTS p9, KYTS p16

config.text: Why does this junction have a 'stop' sign and a stop line on the road?

choices.label: Speed on the major road is derestricted
Visibility along the major road is restricted
The junction is on a downhill gradient

correct.text: Where emerging traffic has a very restricted view of the main road, you may find a 'stop' sign and a solid white stop line. You must stop at the line and then check carefully before you emerge.

incorrect.text: Where emerging traffic has a very restricted view of the main road, you may find a 'stop' sign and a solid white stop line. You must stop at the line and then check carefully before you emerge.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p140

config.text: What does a red traffic light mean?

choices.label: You should stop unless turning left
Stop, if you're able to brake safely
You must stop and wait behind the stop line

correct.text: Whatever light is showing, you should know which light is going to appear next and be able to take appropriate action. For example, when amber is showing on its own, you'll know that red will appear next. This should give you ample time to anticipate and respond safely.

incorrect.text: Whatever light is showing, you should know which light is going to appear next and be able to take appropriate action. For example, when amber is showing on its own, you'll know that red will appear next. This should give you ample time to anticipate and respond safely.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p11

config.text: Which sign means the end of a dual carriageway?

correct.text: If you're overtaking, make sure you move back safely into the left-hand lane before you reach the end of the dual carriageway.

incorrect.text: If you're overtaking, make sure you move back safely into the left-hand lane before you reach the end of the dual carriageway.

meta.xref: DES s6, DES s11, HC r139

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: Lane for heavy and slow vehicles
All lorries use the hard shoulder

correct.text: Where there's a long, steep, uphill gradient on a motorway, a crawler lane may be provided. This helps the traffic to flow by diverting the slower heavy vehicles into a dedicated lane on the left.

incorrect.text: Where there's a long, steep, uphill gradient on a motorway, a crawler lane may be provided. This helps the traffic to flow by diverting the slower heavy vehicles into a dedicated lane on the left.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p98

config.text: What does a sign with a brown background show?

correct.text: Signs with a brown background give directions to places of interest. They're often seen on a motorway, directing you along the easiest route to the attraction.

incorrect.text: Signs with a brown background give directions to places of interest. They're often seen on a motorway, directing you along the easiest route to the attraction.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r110

config.text: Other drivers may sometimes flash their headlights at you. What's the official meaning of this signal?

choices.label: There's a radar speed trap ahead
They're warning you of their presence
There's a fault with your vehicle

correct.text: If other drivers flash their headlights, this isn’t a signal to show priority. The flashing of headlights has the same meaning as sounding the horn: it’s a warning of their presence.

incorrect.text: If other drivers flash their headlights, this isn’t a signal to show priority. The flashing of headlights has the same meaning as sounding the horn: it’s a warning of their presence.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p11

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Don't wait until the last moment before moving into the left-hand lane. Plan ahead and don't rely on other traffic letting you in.

incorrect.text: Don't wait until the last moment before moving into the left-hand lane. Plan ahead and don't rely on other traffic letting you in.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p140

config.text: You're approaching traffic lights and the red light is showing. What signal will show next?

correct.text: If you know which light is going to show next, you can plan your approach accordingly. This can help prevent excessive braking or hesitation at the junction.

incorrect.text: If you know which light is going to show next, you can plan your approach accordingly. This can help prevent excessive braking or hesitation at the junction.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p133, KYTS p151

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: The right-hand lane ahead is narrow

correct.text: Yellow-and-black temporary signs may be used to inform you about roadworks or lane restrictions. Look well ahead. If you have to change lanes, do so in good time.

incorrect.text: Yellow-and-black temporary signs may be used to inform you about roadworks or lane restrictions. Look well ahead. If you have to change lanes, do so in good time.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p58

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: Vehicles may not park on the verge or footway
Vehicles may park on the left-hand side of the road only
Vehicles may park fully on the verge or footway
Vehicles may park on the right-hand side of the road only

correct.text: In order to keep roads free from parked cars, there are some areas where you're allowed to park on the verge. Only do this where you see the sign. Parking on verges or footways anywhere else could lead to a fine.

incorrect.text: In order to keep roads free from parked cars, there are some areas where you're allowed to park on the verge. Only do this where you see the sign. Parking on verges or footways anywhere else could lead to a fine.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128-129, KYTS p10-15

config.text: What information would be shown in a triangular road sign?

correct.text: Warning signs are there to make you aware of potential hazards on the road ahead. Take note of the signs so you're prepared and can take whatever action is necessary.

incorrect.text: Warning signs are there to make you aware of potential hazards on the road ahead. Take note of the signs so you're prepared and can take whatever action is necessary.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p133

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: If you use the right-hand lane in a contraflow system, you'll be travelling with no permanent barrier between you and the oncoming traffic. Observe speed limits and keep a good distance from the vehicle ahead.

incorrect.text: If you use the right-hand lane in a contraflow system, you'll be travelling with no permanent barrier between you and the oncoming traffic. Observe speed limits and keep a good distance from the vehicle ahead.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p118

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: These signs indicate places of interest and are designed to guide you by the easiest route. They're particularly useful when you're unfamiliar with the area.

incorrect.text: These signs indicate places of interest and are designed to guide you by the easiest route. They're particularly useful when you're unfamiliar with the area.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p134, KYTS p78

config.text: What does the white line along the side of the road indicate?

correct.text: A continuous white line is used on many roads to indicate the edge of the carriageway. This can be useful when visibility is restricted. The line is discontinued at junctions, lay-bys, and entrances to or exits from private drives.

incorrect.text: A continuous white line is used on many roads to indicate the edge of the carriageway. This can be useful when visibility is restricted. The line is discontinued at junctions, lay-bys, and entrances to or exits from private drives.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p21

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: Maximum speed limit with traffic calming
Minimum speed limit with traffic calming
Only 20 cars allowed at any one time

correct.text:
If you're in a place where there are likely to be pedestrians (for example, outside a school, near a park, in a residential area or in a shopping area), you should be cautious and keep your speed down.
Many local authorities have taken steps to slow traffic down by creating traffic-calming measures such as road humps. They're there for a reason; slow down.

incorrect.text:
If you're in a place where there are likely to be pedestrians (for example, outside a school, near a park, in a residential area or in a shopping area), you should be cautious and keep your speed down.
Many local authorities have taken steps to slow traffic down by creating traffic-calming measures such as road humps. They're there for a reason; slow down.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p85

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: These humps have been put in place to slow the traffic down. They're usually found in residential areas. Slow down to an appropriate speed.

incorrect.text: These humps have been put in place to slow the traffic down. They're usually found in residential areas. Slow down to an appropriate speed.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p133, KYTS p86

config.text: Which sign means you have priority over oncoming vehicles?

correct.text: Even though you have priority, be prepared to give way if other drivers don't. This will help to avoid congestion, confrontation or even a collision.

incorrect.text: Even though you have priority, be prepared to give way if other drivers don't. This will help to avoid congestion, confrontation or even a collision.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r293, HC p122, KYTS p30, KYTS p141

config.text: You've stopped at a railway level crossing. What should you do if the red lights continue to flash after a train has gone by?

correct.text: You must always obey red flashing stop lights. If a train passes but the lights continue to flash, another train will be passing soon. Cross only when the lights go off and the barriers open.

incorrect.text: You must always obey red flashing stop lights. If a train passes but the lights continue to flash, another train will be passing soon. Cross only when the lights go off and the barriers open.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p135

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: If you intend to stop and rest, this sign allows you time to reduce speed and pull over safely.

incorrect.text: If you intend to stop and rest, this sign allows you time to reduce speed and pull over safely.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p123

config.text: What does this arm signal mean?

choices.label: The driver intends to turn right
The driver intends to turn left

correct.text: There might be an occasion where another driver uses an arm signal. This may be because the vehicle's indicators are obscured by other traffic. In order for such signals to be effective, all drivers should know their meaning. Be aware that the 'left turn' signal might look similar to the 'slowing down' signal.

incorrect.text: There might be an occasion where another driver uses an arm signal. This may be because the vehicle's indicators are obscured by other traffic. In order for such signals to be effective, all drivers should know their meaning. Be aware that the 'left turn' signal might look similar to the 'slowing down' signal.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p9, KYTS p16

config.text: How can you identify traffic signs that give orders?

choices.label: They're rectangular with a yellow border
They're triangular with a blue border
They're square with a brown border
They're circular with a red border

correct.text: There are three basic types of traffic sign: those that warn, those that inform and those that give orders. Generally, triangular signs warn, rectangular signs give information or directions and circular signs give orders. An exception is the eight-sided 'stop' sign.

incorrect.text: There are three basic types of traffic sign: those that warn, those that inform and those that give orders. Generally, triangular signs warn, rectangular signs give information or directions and circular signs give orders. An exception is the eight-sided 'stop' sign.

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: There will also be markings on the road surface to indicate the bus lane. You mustn't use this lane for parking or overtaking.

incorrect.text: There will also be markings on the road surface to indicate the bus lane. You mustn't use this lane for parking or overtaking.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p23

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: This sign is shown where slow-moving vehicles would impede the flow of traffic; for example, in tunnels. However, if you need to slow down or even stop to avoid an incident or potential collision, you should do so.

incorrect.text: This sign is shown where slow-moving vehicles would impede the flow of traffic; for example, in tunnels. However, if you need to slow down or even stop to avoid an incident or potential collision, you should do so.

config.text: What does it mean if you see this signal on the motorway?

choices.label: Leave the motorway at the next exit
All vehicles use the hard shoulder
Sharp bend to the left ahead

correct.text:
You'll see this sign if there has been an incident ahead and the motorway is closed. You must obey the sign. Make sure that you prepare to leave in good time.
Don't cause drivers to take avoiding action by cutting in at the last moment.

incorrect.text:
You'll see this sign if there has been an incident ahead and the motorway is closed. You must obey the sign. Make sure that you prepare to leave in good time.
Don't cause drivers to take avoiding action by cutting in at the last moment.

config.text: Which diagram shows a hazard warning line?

correct.text: You need to know the difference between the normal centre line and a hazard warning line. If there's a hazard ahead, the markings are longer and the gaps shorter. This gives you advance warning of an unspecified hazard.

incorrect.text: You need to know the difference between the normal centre line and a hazard warning line. If there's a hazard ahead, the markings are longer and the gaps shorter. This gives you advance warning of an unspecified hazard.

correct.text: There'll be a plate or additional sign to tell you when the restrictions apply.

incorrect.text: There'll be a plate or additional sign to tell you when the restrictions apply.

config.text: How should you give an arm signal to turn left?

correct.text: There may be occasions when other road users are unable to see your indicator, such as in bright sunlight or at a busy, complicated junction. In these cases, an arm signal will help others to understand your intentions.

incorrect.text: There may be occasions when other road users are unable to see your indicator, such as in bright sunlight or at a busy, complicated junction. In these cases, an arm signal will help others to understand your intentions.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p9-10

config.text: Which shape is used for a 'give way' sign?

correct.text: Other warning signs are the same shape and colour, but the 'give way' triangle points downwards. When you see this sign, you must give way to traffic on the road that you're about to enter.

incorrect.text: Other warning signs are the same shape and colour, but the 'give way' triangle points downwards. When you see this sign, you must give way to traffic on the road that you're about to enter.

config.text: Which sign means no motor vehicles allowed?

correct.text: This sign is used to enable pedestrians to walk free from traffic. It's often found in shopping areas.

incorrect.text: This sign is used to enable pedestrians to walk free from traffic. It's often found in shopping areas.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r106

config.text: How will a police officer in a patrol vehicle signal for you to stop?

choices.label: Flash the headlights, indicate left and point to the left
Overtake and give a slowing down arm signal
Use the siren, overtake, cut in front and stop
Pull alongside you, use the siren and wave you to stop

correct.text: You must obey signals given by the police. If a police officer in a patrol vehicle wants you to pull over, they'll indicate this without causing danger to you or other traffic.

incorrect.text: You must obey signals given by the police. If a police officer in a patrol vehicle wants you to pull over, they'll indicate this without causing danger to you or other traffic.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r104, HC r170

config.text: You're waiting at a T-junction. What should you do if a vehicle is coming from the right, with its left indicator flashing?

choices.label: Wait until the vehicle starts to turn in
Pull out before the vehicle reaches the junction

correct.text: Other road users may give misleading signals. When you’re waiting at a junction, don’t emerge until you’re sure of their intentions.

incorrect.text: Other road users may give misleading signals. When you’re waiting at a junction, don’t emerge until you’re sure of their intentions.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p11

config.text: Which sign means there will be two-way traffic crossing your route ahead?

correct.text: This sign is found in or at the end of a one-way system. It warns you that traffic will be crossing your path from both directions.

incorrect.text: This sign is found in or at the end of a one-way system. It warns you that traffic will be crossing your path from both directions.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p140

config.text: You see this amber traffic light ahead. Which light, or lights, will come on next?

correct.text:
At junctions controlled by traffic lights, you must stop behind the white line until the lights change to green. A red light, an amber light, and red and amber lights showing together all mean stop.
You may proceed when the light is green unless your exit road is blocked or pedestrians are crossing in front of you.
If you're approaching traffic lights that are visible from a distance and the light has been green for some time, be ready to slow down and stop, because the lights are likely to change.

incorrect.text:
At junctions controlled by traffic lights, you must stop behind the white line until the lights change to green. A red light, an amber light, and red and amber lights showing together all mean stop.
You may proceed when the light is green unless your exit road is blocked or pedestrians are crossing in front of you.
If you're approaching traffic lights that are visible from a distance and the light has been green for some time, be ready to slow down and stop, because the lights are likely to change.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r128, KYTS p75

config.text: What does this white arrow on the road mean?

choices.label: Return to your side of the road

correct.text: The arrow indicates the direction in which to pass hatch markings or double white lines. If you're overtaking, you must return to the left-hand side of the road.

incorrect.text: The arrow indicates the direction in which to pass hatch markings or double white lines. If you're overtaking, you must return to the left-hand side of the road.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p65

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: You can park on the days and times shown
No parking on the days and times shown
No parking at all from Monday to Friday
End of the urban clearway restrictions

correct.text: Urban clearways are provided to keep traffic flowing at busy times. You may stop only briefly to set down or pick up passengers. Times of operation will vary from place to place, so always check the signs.

incorrect.text: Urban clearways are provided to keep traffic flowing at busy times. You may stop only briefly to set down or pick up passengers. Times of operation will vary from place to place, so always check the signs.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p12

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: You should be careful in these locations, as the road surface is likely to be wet and slippery. There may be a steep drop to the water, and there may not be a barrier along the edge of the road.

incorrect.text: You should be careful in these locations, as the road surface is likely to be wet and slippery. There may be a steep drop to the water, and there may not be a barrier along the edge of the road.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p19

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Road signs that prohibit overtaking are placed in locations where passing the vehicle in front is dangerous. If you see this sign, don't attempt to overtake. The sign is there for a reason; you must obey it.

incorrect.text: Road signs that prohibit overtaking are placed in locations where passing the vehicle in front is dangerous. If you see this sign, don't attempt to overtake. The sign is there for a reason; you must obey it.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p133, KYTS p86

config.text: What's the meaning of this traffic sign?

choices.label: Give priority to vehicles coming towards you
You have priority over vehicles coming towards you

correct.text: Don't force your way through. Show courtesy and consideration to other road users. Although you have priority, make sure oncoming traffic is going to give way before you continue.

incorrect.text: Don't force your way through. Show courtesy and consideration to other road users. Although you have priority, make sure oncoming traffic is going to give way before you continue.

meta.xref: DES s6

config.text: Who has priority when traffic lights are out of order?

correct.text: When traffic lights are out of order, you should treat the junction as an unmarked crossroads. Be cautious, as you may need to give way or stop. Look for traffic attempting to cross the junction, unaware that it doesn’t have priority.

incorrect.text: When traffic lights are out of order, you should treat the junction as an unmarked crossroads. Be cautious, as you may need to give way or stop. Look for traffic attempting to cross the junction, unaware that it doesn’t have priority.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r103

config.text: Why should you make sure that your indicators are cancelled after turning at a junction?

choices.label: To avoid misleading other road users
To avoid dazzling other road users
To avoid damage to the indicator relay

correct.text: Leaving your indicators on could confuse other road users and may even lead to a crash. Be aware that if you haven’t turned sharply, your indicators may not self-cancel and you'll need to turn them off manually.

incorrect.text: Leaving your indicators on could confuse other road users and may even lead to a crash. Be aware that if you haven’t turned sharply, your indicators may not self-cancel and you'll need to turn them off manually.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p64

config.text: Which sign means 'no stopping'?

correct.text: Stopping where this clearway restriction applies is likely to cause congestion. Allow the traffic to flow by obeying the signs.

incorrect.text: Stopping where this clearway restriction applies is likely to cause congestion. Allow the traffic to flow by obeying the signs.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p48

config.text: What's the national speed limit on a single carriageway road?

correct.text: If you're travelling on a dual carriageway that becomes a single carriageway road, reduce your speed gradually so that you aren't exceeding the limit as you enter. There might not be a sign to remind you of the limit, so make sure you know the speed limits for different types of road and vehicle.

incorrect.text: If you're travelling on a dual carriageway that becomes a single carriageway road, reduce your speed gradually so that you aren't exceeding the limit as you enter. There might not be a sign to remind you of the limit, so make sure you know the speed limits for different types of road and vehicle.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p133

config.text: What does this traffic sign mean?

correct.text: The sign gives you an early warning of a speed restriction. If you're travelling at a higher speed, slow down in good time. You could come across queuing traffic due to roadworks or a temporary obstruction.

incorrect.text: The sign gives you an early warning of a speed restriction. If you're travelling at a higher speed, slow down in good time. You could come across queuing traffic due to roadworks or a temporary obstruction.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p133, KYTS p157

config.text: You're on a motorway. A lorry has stopped in the right-hand lane. What should you do when you see this sign on the lorry?

choices.label: Pass the lorry on the left
Leave the motorway at the next exit

correct.text: Sometimes work is carried out on the motorway without closing the lanes. When this happens, signs are mounted on the back of lorries to warn other road users of the roadworks ahead.

incorrect.text: Sometimes work is carried out on the motorway without closing the lanes. When this happens, signs are mounted on the back of lorries to warn other road users of the roadworks ahead.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p13

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: It will take up to 10 times longer to stop when it's icy. Where there's a risk of icy conditions, you need to be aware of this and take extra care. If you think the road may be icy, don't brake or steer harshly, as your tyres could lose their grip on the road.

incorrect.text: It will take up to 10 times longer to stop when it's icy. Where there's a risk of icy conditions, you need to be aware of this and take extra care. If you think the road may be icy, don't brake or steer harshly, as your tyres could lose their grip on the road.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p12

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: This sign gives you an early warning that the road ahead will slope downhill. Prepare to alter your speed and gear. Looking at the sign from left to right will show you whether the road slopes uphill or downhill.

incorrect.text: This sign gives you an early warning that the road ahead will slope downhill. Prepare to alter your speed and gear. Looking at the sign from left to right will show you whether the road slopes uphill or downhill.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p11

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: Two-way traffic crosses a one-way road
Two-way traffic crosses a two-way road

correct.text: Be prepared for traffic approaching from junctions on either side of you. Try to avoid unnecessary changing of lanes just before the junction.

incorrect.text: Be prepared for traffic approaching from junctions on either side of you. Try to avoid unnecessary changing of lanes just before the junction.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p16

config.text: In winter, road signs can become covered by snow. What does this sign mean?

correct.text: The 'stop' sign is the only road sign that's octagonal. This is so that it can be recognised and obeyed even if it's obscured (for example, by snow).

incorrect.text: The 'stop' sign is the only road sign that's octagonal. This is so that it can be recognised and obeyed even if it's obscured (for example, by snow).

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p20

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: When you see this sign, look out for any direction signs and judge whether you need to signal your intentions. Do this in good time so that other road users approaching the roundabout know what you're planning to do.

incorrect.text: When you see this sign, look out for any direction signs and judge whether you need to signal your intentions. Do this in good time so that other road users approaching the roundabout know what you're planning to do.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r130, HC p134, KYTS p76

config.text: What's the reason for the hatched area along the centre of this road?

choices.label: It separates traffic flowing in opposite directions
It marks an area to be used by overtaking motorcyclists
It's a temporary marking to warn of the roadworks
It separates the two sides of the dual carriageway

correct.text: Areas of 'hatched markings' such as these separate traffic streams that could be a danger to each other. They're often seen on bends or where the road becomes narrow. If the area is bordered by a solid white line, you mustn't enter it except in an emergency.

incorrect.text: Areas of 'hatched markings' such as these separate traffic streams that could be a danger to each other. They're often seen on bends or where the road becomes narrow. If the area is bordered by a solid white line, you mustn't enter it except in an emergency.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p140

config.text: You're at a junction controlled by traffic lights. When should you wait at a green light?

choices.label: When pedestrians are waiting to cross
When your exit from the junction is blocked
When you think the lights may be about to change
When you intend to turn right

correct.text: As you approach the traffic lights, look into the road you wish to take. Only proceed if your exit road is clear. If the road is blocked, hold back, even if you have to wait for the next green signal.

incorrect.text: As you approach the traffic lights, look into the road you wish to take. Only proceed if your exit road is clear. If the road is blocked, hold back, even if you have to wait for the next green signal.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p12

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: You'll need to slow down. At hump bridges, your view ahead will be restricted and the road will often be narrow. If the bridge is very steep, sound your horn to warn others of your approach. Going over the bridge too fast is highly dangerous to other road users and could even cause your wheels to leave the road, with a resulting loss of control.

incorrect.text: You'll need to slow down. At hump bridges, your view ahead will be restricted and the road will often be narrow. If the bridge is very steep, sound your horn to warn others of your approach. Going over the bridge too fast is highly dangerous to other road users and could even cause your wheels to leave the road, with a resulting loss of control.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p107

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: Through traffic to use left lane

correct.text: You should change lanes as directed by the sign. Here, the right-hand lane is closed but the left-hand and centre lanes are available. Merging in turn is recommended when it's safe and traffic is going slowly; for example, at roadworks or a road traffic incident. When vehicles are travelling at speed, this isn't advisable and you should move into the appropriate lane in good time.

incorrect.text: You should change lanes as directed by the sign. Here, the right-hand lane is closed but the left-hand and centre lanes are available. Merging in turn is recommended when it's safe and traffic is going slowly; for example, at roadworks or a road traffic incident. When vehicles are travelling at speed, this isn't advisable and you should move into the appropriate lane in good time.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r132, KYTS p84

config.text: Where would you find green reflective studs on a motorway?

choices.label: Between the hard shoulder and the carriageway
Between the carriageway and the central reservation

correct.text: Knowing the colours of the reflective studs on the road will help you judge your position, especially at night, in foggy conditions or when visibility is poor.

incorrect.text: Knowing the colours of the reflective studs on the road will help you judge your position, especially at night, in foggy conditions or when visibility is poor.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p86

config.text: Where would you see this road marking?

correct.text: Because the road has a dark colour, changes in level aren't easily seen. White triangles painted on the road surface give you an indication of where there are road humps.

incorrect.text: Because the road has a dark colour, changes in level aren't easily seen. White triangles painted on the road surface give you an indication of where there are road humps.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p81-82

config.text: Where would you find these road markings?

correct.text: These markings show the direction in which the traffic should go at a mini-roundabout.

incorrect.text: These markings show the direction in which the traffic should go at a mini-roundabout.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p29

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: Level crossing with gate or barrier
Level crossing without gate or barrier

correct.text: Some crossings have gates but no attendant or signals. You should stop, look both ways, listen and make sure that no train is approaching. If there's a telephone, contact the signal operator to make sure it's safe to cross.

incorrect.text: Some crossings have gates but no attendant or signals. You should stop, look both ways, listen and make sure that no train is approaching. If there's a telephone, contact the signal operator to make sure it's safe to cross.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p13, KYTS p29, KYTS p141

config.text: Where would you find these flashing red light signals?

correct.text: These signals are found at level crossings, swing or lifting bridges, some airfields and emergency access sites. The flashing red lights mean stop whether or not the way seems to be clear.

incorrect.text: These signals are found at level crossings, swing or lifting bridges, some airfields and emergency access sites. The flashing red lights mean stop whether or not the way seems to be clear.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p34

config.text: What does this signal mean?

choices.label: Both trams and cars must stop
Both trams and cars can continue

correct.text: The white light shows that trams must stop. The green light shows that other vehicles can go if the way is clear. Trams are being introduced into more cities, so you're likely to come across them and you should learn which signs apply to them.

incorrect.text: The white light shows that trams must stop. The green light shows that other vehicles can go if the way is clear. Trams are being introduced into more cities, so you're likely to come across them and you should learn which signs apply to them.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p24-25

config.text: Which type of vehicle does this sign apply to?

correct.text: The triangular shapes above and below the dimensions indicate a height restriction that applies to the road ahead.

incorrect.text: The triangular shapes above and below the dimensions indicate a height restriction that applies to the road ahead.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p17

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: A sign will indicate which types of vehicles are prohibited from certain roads. Make sure that you know which signs apply to the vehicle you're using.

incorrect.text: A sign will indicate which types of vehicles are prohibited from certain roads. Make sure that you know which signs apply to the vehicle you're using.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p20

config.text: What should you be aware of if you've just passed this sign?

choices.label: You can't stop on this road
Only one lane is in use
All traffic is going one way

correct.text: In a one-way system, traffic may pass you on either side. Always be aware of all traffic signs and understand their meaning. Look well ahead and react to them in good time.

incorrect.text: In a one-way system, traffic may pass you on either side. Always be aware of all traffic signs and understand their meaning. Look well ahead and react to them in good time.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p21

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Where you see this sign, the 20 mph restriction ends and a 30 mph restriction starts. Check all around for possible hazards and only increase your speed if it's safe to do so.

incorrect.text: Where you see this sign, the 20 mph restriction ends and a 30 mph restriction starts. Check all around for possible hazards and only increase your speed if it's safe to do so.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p33

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Take extra care when you encounter trams. Look out for road markings and signs that alert you to them. Modern trams are very quiet and you may not hear them approaching.

incorrect.text: Take extra care when you encounter trams. Look out for road markings and signs that alert you to them. Modern trams are very quiet and you may not hear them approaching.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p131

config.text: Which is the sign for a ring road?

correct.text: Ring roads are designed to relieve congestion in towns and city centres.

incorrect.text: Ring roads are designed to relieve congestion in towns and city centres.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p16

config.text: What shape is a 'stop' sign?

correct.text: To make it easy to recognise, the 'stop' sign is the only sign of this shape. You must stop and take effective observation before proceeding.

incorrect.text: To make it easy to recognise, the 'stop' sign is the only sign of this shape. You must stop and take effective observation before proceeding.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r127, HC p134, KYTS p74

config.text: What does this road marking mean?

correct.text: A single broken line along the centre of the road, with long markings and short gaps, is a hazard warning line. Don't cross it unless you can see that the road is clear well ahead.

incorrect.text: A single broken line along the centre of the road, with long markings and short gaps, is a hazard warning line. Don't cross it unless you can see that the road is clear well ahead.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p132, KYTS p104

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: When you leave the motorway, make sure that you check your speedometer. You may be going faster than you realise. Slow down and look for speed-limit signs.

incorrect.text: When you leave the motorway, make sure that you check your speedometer. You may be going faster than you realise. Slow down and look for speed-limit signs.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p12

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: A warning sign with a picture of a windsock indicates that there may be strong side winds. This sign is often found on exposed roads.

incorrect.text: A warning sign with a picture of a windsock indicates that there may be strong side winds. This sign is often found on exposed roads.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r103

config.text: You're driving in busy traffic. You want to pull up just after a junction on the left. When should you signal?

choices.label: As you're passing or just after the junction
Just before you reach the junction
Well before you reach the junction
It would be better not to signal at all

correct.text: You need to signal to let other drivers know your intentions. However, if you indicate too early, they may think you're turning left into the junction. Correct timing of the signal is very important to avoid misleading others.

incorrect.text: You need to signal to let other drivers know your intentions. However, if you indicate too early, they may think you're turning left into the junction. Correct timing of the signal is very important to avoid misleading others.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p105

config.text: What does this motorway sign mean?

choices.label: Change to the lane on your left
Leave the motorway at the next exit
Pull up on the hard shoulder

correct.text:
On the motorway, signs sometimes show temporary warnings due to traffic or weather conditions. They may be used to indicate
  • lane closures
  • temporary speed limits
  • weather warnings.

incorrect.text:
On the motorway, signs sometimes show temporary warnings due to traffic or weather conditions. They may be used to indicate
  • lane closures
  • temporary speed limits
  • weather warnings.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p16

config.text: What must you do when you see this sign?

choices.label: Stop only if traffic is approaching
Stop even if the road is clear
Stop only if children are waiting to cross
Stop only if a red light is showing

correct.text: 'Stop' signs are situated at junctions where visibility is restricted or where there's heavy traffic. They must be obeyed: you must stop. Look carefully before moving off.

incorrect.text: 'Stop' signs are situated at junctions where visibility is restricted or where there's heavy traffic. They must be obeyed: you must stop. Look carefully before moving off.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p11

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: Two-way traffic crosses a one-way road

correct.text: This sign may be at the end of a dual carriageway or a one-way street. It's there to warn you of oncoming traffic.

incorrect.text: This sign may be at the end of a dual carriageway or a one-way street. It's there to warn you of oncoming traffic.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p131, KYTS p125

config.text: What does this sign indicate?

correct.text: When a diversion route has been put in place, drivers are advised to follow a symbol, which may be a black triangle, square, circle or diamond shape on a yellow background.

incorrect.text: When a diversion route has been put in place, drivers are advised to follow a symbol, which may be a black triangle, square, circle or diamond shape on a yellow background.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p19

config.text: Which sign means turn left ahead?

correct.text: Blue circles tell you what you must do and this sign gives a clear instruction to turn left ahead. You should be looking out for signs at all times and know what they mean.

incorrect.text: Blue circles tell you what you must do and this sign gives a clear instruction to turn left ahead. You should be looking out for signs at all times and know what they mean.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p33

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Avoid blocking tram routes. Trams are fixed on their route and can't manoeuvre around other vehicles or pedestrians. Modern trams travel quickly and are quiet, so you might not hear them approaching.

incorrect.text: Avoid blocking tram routes. Trams are fixed on their route and can't manoeuvre around other vehicles or pedestrians. Modern trams travel quickly and are quiet, so you might not hear them approaching.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p19

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: Approaching traffic passes you on both sides
Turn off at the next available junction
Pass either side to get to the same destination

correct.text: These signs are often seen in one-way streets that have more than one lane. When you see this sign, use the route that's the most convenient and doesn't require a late change of direction.

incorrect.text: These signs are often seen in one-way streets that have more than one lane. When you see this sign, use the route that's the most convenient and doesn't require a late change of direction.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p33

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Obey the 'give way' signs. Trams are unable to steer around you if you misjudge when it's safe to enter the junction.

incorrect.text: Obey the 'give way' signs. Trams are unable to steer around you if you misjudge when it's safe to enter the junction.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p12

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: This sign is found where a shallow stream crosses the road. Heavy rainfall could increase the flow of water. If the water looks too deep or the stream has spread over a large distance, stop and find another route.

incorrect.text: This sign is found where a shallow stream crosses the road. Heavy rainfall could increase the flow of water. If the water looks too deep or the stream has spread over a large distance, stop and find another route.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r106

config.text: A police car is following you. What should you do if the police officer flashes the headlights and points to the left?

choices.label: Turn left at the next junction

correct.text: You must pull up on the left as soon as it’s safe to do so and switch off your engine.

incorrect.text: You must pull up on the left as soon as it’s safe to do so and switch off your engine.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p134, KYTS p81

config.text: What does this line across the road at the entrance to a roundabout mean?

choices.label: Give way to traffic from the right
Traffic from the left has right of way

correct.text: Slow down as you approach the roundabout and check for traffic from the right. If you need to stop and give way, stay behind the broken line until it's safe to emerge onto the roundabout.

incorrect.text: Slow down as you approach the roundabout and check for traffic from the right. If you need to stop and give way, stay behind the broken line until it's safe to emerge onto the roundabout.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p140

config.text: You're in the left-hand lane at traffic lights, waiting to turn left. Which signal means you must wait?

correct.text: At some junctions, there may be separate signals for different lanes. These are called 'filter' lights. They're designed to help traffic flow at major junctions. Make sure that you're in the correct lane and proceed if the way is clear and the green light shows for your lane.

incorrect.text: At some junctions, there may be separate signals for different lanes. These are called 'filter' lights. They're designed to help traffic flow at major junctions. Make sure that you're in the correct lane and proceed if the way is clear and the green light shows for your lane.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p10

config.text: What's the purpose of triangular shaped signs?

correct.text: Triangular signs warn you of hazards ahead. Make sure you look at each sign that you pass on the road, so that you don't miss any vital instructions or information.

incorrect.text: Triangular signs warn you of hazards ahead. Make sure you look at each sign that you pass on the road, so that you don't miss any vital instructions or information.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p9

config.text: What messages are given by circular traffic signs that have a blue background?

choices.label: They give temporary directions during a diversion
They give directions to car parks

correct.text: Signs with blue circles generally give mandatory instruction. These are often found in urban areas and include signs for mini-roundabouts and directional arrows.

incorrect.text: Signs with blue circles generally give mandatory instruction. These are often found in urban areas and include signs for mini-roundabouts and directional arrows.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p12

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: When approaching a tunnel, switch on your dipped headlights. Be aware that your eyes might need to adjust to the sudden darkness. You may need to reduce your speed.

incorrect.text: When approaching a tunnel, switch on your dipped headlights. Be aware that your eyes might need to adjust to the sudden darkness. You may need to reduce your speed.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p35

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: No waiting for buses and cycles

correct.text: Buses and cycles can travel in this lane. In this example, they'll flow in the same direction as other traffic. If it's busy, they may be passing you on the left, so watch out for them. Times on the sign will show the lane's hours of operation; if no times are shown, or there's no sign at all, this means the lane is in operation 24 hours a day. In some areas, other vehicles, such as taxis and motorcycles, are allowed to use bus lanes. The sign will show if this is the case.

incorrect.text: Buses and cycles can travel in this lane. In this example, they'll flow in the same direction as other traffic. If it's busy, they may be passing you on the left, so watch out for them. Times on the sign will show the lane's hours of operation; if no times are shown, or there's no sign at all, this means the lane is in operation 24 hours a day. In some areas, other vehicles, such as taxis and motorcycles, are allowed to use bus lanes. The sign will show if this is the case.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p13-14

config.text: What does this traffic sign mean?

correct.text: This sign is there to alert you to the likelihood of danger ahead. It may be accompanied by a plate indicating the type of hazard. Be ready to reduce your speed and take avoiding action.

incorrect.text: This sign is there to alert you to the likelihood of danger ahead. It may be accompanied by a plate indicating the type of hazard. Be ready to reduce your speed and take avoiding action.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p105, KYTS p107

config.text: What does this motorway sign mean?

correct.text: Look out for signs above your lane or on the central reservation. These will give you important information or warnings about the road ahead. To allow for the high speed of motorway traffic, these signs may light up some distance from any hazard. Don't ignore the signs just because the road looks clear to you.

incorrect.text: Look out for signs above your lane or on the central reservation. These will give you important information or warnings about the road ahead. To allow for the high speed of motorway traffic, these signs may light up some distance from any hazard. Don't ignore the signs just because the road looks clear to you.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p10

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: The priority through the junction is shown by the broader line. You need to be aware of the hazard posed by traffic crossing or pulling out onto a major road.

incorrect.text: The priority through the junction is shown by the broader line. You need to be aware of the hazard posed by traffic crossing or pulling out onto a major road.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p13-14

config.text: You're about to overtake. What should you do when you see this sign?

choices.label: Overtake the other driver as quickly as possible
Move to the right to get a better view
Switch your headlights on before overtaking
Hold back until you can see clearly ahead

correct.text:
You won't be able to see any hazards that might be hidden in the dip. As well as oncoming traffic, the dip may conceal
  • cyclists
  • horse riders
  • parked vehicles
  • pedestrians
in the road.

incorrect.text:
You won't be able to see any hazards that might be hidden in the dip. As well as oncoming traffic, the dip may conceal
  • cyclists
  • horse riders
  • parked vehicles
  • pedestrians
in the road.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p137

config.text: You're in a tunnel and you see this sign. What does it mean?

choices.label: Direction to an emergency pedestrian exit
Beware of pedestrians: no footpath ahead

correct.text: If you have to leave your vehicle and get out of a tunnel by an emergency exit, do so as quickly as you can. Follow the signs directing you to the nearest exit point. If there are several people using the exit, don't panic but try to leave in a calm and orderly manner.

incorrect.text: If you have to leave your vehicle and get out of a tunnel by an emergency exit, do so as quickly as you can. Follow the signs directing you to the nearest exit point. If there are several people using the exit, don't panic but try to leave in a calm and orderly manner.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p17

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: 'No entry' signs are used in places such as one-way streets to prevent vehicles driving against the traffic. To ignore one would be dangerous, both for yourself and for other road users, as well as being against the law.

incorrect.text: 'No entry' signs are used in places such as one-way streets to prevent vehicles driving against the traffic. To ignore one would be dangerous, both for yourself and for other road users, as well as being against the law.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r132, KYTS p84

config.text: Where can you find reflective amber studs on a motorway?

choices.label: Separating the slip road from the motorway
On the left-hand edge of the road
On the right-hand edge of the road

correct.text: At night or in poor visibility, reflective studs on the road help you to judge your position on the carriageway.

incorrect.text: At night or in poor visibility, reflective studs on the road help you to judge your position on the carriageway.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r129, HC p134, KYTS p76

config.text: When may you cross a double solid white line in the middle of the road?

choices.label: To pass traffic that's queuing back at a junction
To pass a car signalling to turn left ahead
To pass a road maintenance vehicle travelling at 10 mph or less
To pass a vehicle that's towing a trailer

correct.text: You may cross the solid white line to pass a stationary vehicle or to pass a pedal cycle, horse or road maintenance vehicle if it's travelling at 10 mph or less. You may also cross the solid white line to enter a side road or access a property.

incorrect.text: You may cross the solid white line to pass a stationary vehicle or to pass a pedal cycle, horse or road maintenance vehicle if it's travelling at 10 mph or less. You may also cross the solid white line to enter a side road or access a property.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p10

config.text: Which sign means there's a double bend ahead?

correct.text: Triangular signs give you a warning of hazards ahead. They're there to give you time to prepare for the hazard; for example, by adjusting your speed.

incorrect.text: Triangular signs give you a warning of hazards ahead. They're there to give you time to prepare for the hazard; for example, by adjusting your speed.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p9, KYTS p16

config.text: What shape are traffic signs giving orders?

correct.text: Road signs in the shape of a circle give orders. Those with a red circle are mostly prohibitive. The 'stop' sign is octagonal to give it greater prominence. Signs giving orders must always be obeyed.

incorrect.text: Road signs in the shape of a circle give orders. Those with a red circle are mostly prohibitive. The 'stop' sign is octagonal to give it greater prominence. Signs giving orders must always be obeyed.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p13

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Look well ahead and be ready to stop for any pedestrians crossing, or about to cross, the road. Also check the pavements for anyone who looks like they might step or run into the road.

incorrect.text: Look well ahead and be ready to stop for any pedestrians crossing, or about to cross, the road. Also check the pavements for anyone who looks like they might step or run into the road.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r112

config.text: When may you sound your vehicle's horn?

choices.label: To give you right of way
To warn others of your presence
To make slower drivers move over

correct.text: Never sound your vehicle's horn aggressively. You mustn't sound it in a built-up area between 11.30 pm and 7.00 am, or when you're stationary, unless another road user poses a danger. Don't scare animals by sounding your horn.

incorrect.text: Never sound your vehicle's horn aggressively. You mustn't sound it in a built-up area between 11.30 pm and 7.00 am, or when you're stationary, unless another road user poses a danger. Don't scare animals by sounding your horn.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p33

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: This sign tells you to beware of trams. If you don't usually drive in a town where there are trams, remember to look out for them at junctions and look for tram rails, signs and signals.

incorrect.text: This sign tells you to beware of trams. If you don't usually drive in a town where there are trams, remember to look out for them at junctions and look for tram rails, signs and signals.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r103, HC p123

config.text: Which arm signal tells you that the car you're following is going to pull up?

correct.text: There may be occasions when drivers need to give an arm signal to confirm their intentions. This could include in bright sunshine, at a complex road layout, when stopping at a pedestrian crossing or when turning right just after passing a parked vehicle. You should understand what each arm signal means. If you give arm signals, make them clear, correct and decisive.

incorrect.text: There may be occasions when drivers need to give an arm signal to confirm their intentions. This could include in bright sunshine, at a complex road layout, when stopping at a pedestrian crossing or when turning right just after passing a parked vehicle. You should understand what each arm signal means. If you give arm signals, make them clear, correct and decisive.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p17

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: You must comply with all traffic signs and be especially aware of those signs that apply specifically to the type of vehicle you're using.

incorrect.text: You must comply with all traffic signs and be especially aware of those signs that apply specifically to the type of vehicle you're using.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p105

config.text: What should you do when you see this sign as you travel along a motorway?

choices.label: Leave the motorway at the next exit

correct.text: You'll see this sign if the motorway is closed ahead. Pull into the left-hand lane as soon as it's safe to do so. Don't wait until the last moment before you move across, because the lane may be busy and you'll have to rely on another driver making room for you.

incorrect.text: You'll see this sign if the motorway is closed ahead. Pull into the left-hand lane as soon as it's safe to do so. Don't wait until the last moment before you move across, because the lane may be busy and you'll have to rely on another driver making room for you.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r127, HC p134, KYTS p74

config.text: What do the long white lines along the centre of the road mean?

correct.text: The centre of the road is usually marked by a broken white line, with lines that are shorter than the gaps. When the lines become longer than the gaps, this is a hazard warning line. Look well ahead for these, especially when you're planning to overtake or turn off.

incorrect.text: The centre of the road is usually marked by a broken white line, with lines that are shorter than the gaps. When the lines become longer than the gaps, this is a hazard warning line. Look well ahead for these, especially when you're planning to overtake or turn off.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p140

config.text: At traffic lights, what does it mean when the amber light shows on its own?

choices.label: Go if the way is clear
Go if no pedestrians are crossing

correct.text: When the amber light is showing on its own, the red light will follow next. The amber light means stop, unless you've already crossed the stop line or you're so close to it that stopping may cause a collision.

incorrect.text: When the amber light is showing on its own, the red light will follow next. The amber light means stop, unless you've already crossed the stop line or you're so close to it that stopping may cause a collision.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r116

config.text: When may you use hazard warning lights while you're driving?

choices.label: Instead of sounding the horn in a built-up area between 11.30 pm and 7.00 am
On a motorway or unrestricted dual carriageway, to warn of a hazard ahead
On rural routes, after a sign warning of animals
On the approach to toucan crossings, where cyclists are waiting to cross

correct.text: When there’s queuing traffic ahead and you have to slow down or even stop, briefly showing your hazard warning lights will help alert the traffic behind to the hazard.

incorrect.text: When there’s queuing traffic ahead and you have to slow down or even stop, briefly showing your hazard warning lights will help alert the traffic behind to the hazard.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p64

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: This is the sign for a clearway. Clearways are stretches of road where you aren't allowed to stop unless it's an emergency. Stopping where these restrictions apply may be dangerous and is likely to cause an obstruction. Restrictions might apply for several miles and this may be indicated on the sign.

incorrect.text: This is the sign for a clearway. Clearways are stretches of road where you aren't allowed to stop unless it's an emergency. Stopping where these restrictions apply may be dangerous and is likely to cause an obstruction. Restrictions might apply for several miles and this may be indicated on the sign.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p133, KYTS p134

config.text: Which sign informs you that you're coming to a 'no through road'?

correct.text: This sign is found at the entrance to a road that can only be used for access.

incorrect.text: This sign is found at the entrance to a road that can only be used for access.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p37

config.text: Where would you see a contraflow bus lane?

correct.text: The traffic permitted to use a contraflow lane travels in the opposite direction to traffic in the other lanes on the road.

incorrect.text: The traffic permitted to use a contraflow lane travels in the opposite direction to traffic in the other lanes on the road.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r191, KYTS p143

config.text: What do these zigzag white lines mean?

choices.label: Parking allowed only for a short time

correct.text: The approach to, and exit from, a pedestrian crossing is marked with zigzag lines. You mustn't park on them or overtake the leading vehicle when approaching the crossing. Parking here would block the view for pedestrians and approaching traffic.

incorrect.text: The approach to, and exit from, a pedestrian crossing is marked with zigzag lines. You mustn't park on them or overtake the leading vehicle when approaching the crossing. Parking here would block the view for pedestrians and approaching traffic.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p21

config.text: Which sign means that the national speed limit applies?

correct.text: You should know the speed limit for the road on which you're travelling and for your vehicle. The different speed limits are shown in The Highway Code.

incorrect.text: You should know the speed limit for the road on which you're travelling and for your vehicle. The different speed limits are shown in The Highway Code.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p13

config.text: Which of these signs warns you of a zebra crossing?

correct.text: Look well ahead and check the pavements and surrounding areas for pedestrians. Look for anyone walking towards the crossing. Check your mirrors for traffic behind, in case you have to slow down or stop.

incorrect.text: Look well ahead and check the pavements and surrounding areas for pedestrians. Look for anyone walking towards the crossing. Check your mirrors for traffic behind, in case you have to slow down or stop.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p19

config.text: What does this traffic sign mean?

correct.text:
Priority signs are normally shown where the road is narrow and there isn't enough room for two vehicles to pass. Examples are narrow bridges, roadworks and where there's a width restriction.
Make sure you know who has priority; don't force your way through. Show courtesy and consideration to other road users.

incorrect.text:
Priority signs are normally shown where the road is narrow and there isn't enough room for two vehicles to pass. Examples are narrow bridges, roadworks and where there's a width restriction.
Make sure you know who has priority; don't force your way through. Show courtesy and consideration to other road users.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p15

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Where there's a cycle route ahead, a sign will show a bicycle in a red warning triangle. Watch out for children on bicycles and cyclists rejoining the main road.

incorrect.text: Where there's a cycle route ahead, a sign will show a bicycle in a red warning triangle. Watch out for children on bicycles and cyclists rejoining the main road.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p130, KYTS p93

config.text: What does '25' mean on this motorway sign?

choices.label: The distance to the nearest town
The route number of the road
The number of the next junction
The speed limit on the slip road

correct.text: Before you set out on your journey, use a road map to plan your route. When you see an advance warning of your junction, make sure you get into the correct lane in plenty of time. Last-minute harsh braking and cutting across lanes at speed is extremely hazardous.

incorrect.text: Before you set out on your journey, use a road map to plan your route. When you see an advance warning of your junction, make sure you get into the correct lane in plenty of time. Last-minute harsh braking and cutting across lanes at speed is extremely hazardous.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p124

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: No parking for buses or coaches
Direction to bus and coach park
Parking area for cars and coaches

correct.text:
To ease the congestion in town centres, some cities and towns provide park-and-ride schemes. These allow you to park in a designated area and ride by bus into the centre.
Park-and-ride schemes are usually cheaper and easier than car parking in the town centre.

incorrect.text:
To ease the congestion in town centres, some cities and towns provide park-and-ride schemes. These allow you to park in a designated area and ride by bus into the centre.
Park-and-ride schemes are usually cheaper and easier than car parking in the town centre.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p132, KYTS p63

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Even though you've left the restricted area, make sure that you park where you won't endanger other road users or cause an obstruction.

incorrect.text: Even though you've left the restricted area, make sure that you park where you won't endanger other road users or cause an obstruction.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r112

config.text: Your vehicle is stationary. When may you use its horn?

choices.label: When another road user poses a danger
When the road is blocked by queuing traffic
When signalling that you've just arrived

correct.text: When your vehicle is stationary, only sound the horn if you think there's a risk of danger from another road user. Don't use it just to attract someone's attention. This causes unnecessary noise and could be misleading.

incorrect.text: When your vehicle is stationary, only sound the horn if you think there's a risk of danger from another road user. Don't use it just to attract someone's attention. This causes unnecessary noise and could be misleading.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p140

config.text: What should you do when you're approaching traffic lights that have red and amber showing together?

choices.label: Pass the lights if the road is clear
Take care because there's a fault with the lights
Stop because the lights are changing to red

correct.text: Be aware that other traffic might still be clearing the junction as you approach. A green light means you may go on, but only if the way is clear.

incorrect.text: Be aware that other traffic might still be clearing the junction as you approach. A green light means you may go on, but only if the way is clear.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p13

config.text: Which sign means that pedestrians may be walking along the road?

correct.text: When you pass pedestrians in the road, leave plenty of room. You might have to use the right-hand side of the road, so look well ahead, as well as in your mirrors, before pulling out. Take great care if a bend in the road obscures your view ahead.

incorrect.text: When you pass pedestrians in the road, leave plenty of room. You might have to use the right-hand side of the road, so look well ahead, as well as in your mirrors, before pulling out. Take great care if a bend in the road obscures your view ahead.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p124

config.text: You're approaching a junction where the traffic lights aren't working. What should you do when a police officer gives this signal?

correct.text: When a police officer or traffic warden is directing traffic, you must obey them. They'll use the arm signals shown in The Highway Code. Learn what these signals mean and obey them.

incorrect.text: When a police officer or traffic warden is directing traffic, you must obey them. They'll use the arm signals shown in The Highway Code. Learn what these signals mean and obey them.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p17

config.text: Which sign means 'no entry'?

correct.text: Look for and obey traffic signs. Disobeying or not seeing a sign could be dangerous. It may also be an offence for which you could be prosecuted.

incorrect.text: Look for and obey traffic signs. Disobeying or not seeing a sign could be dangerous. It may also be an offence for which you could be prosecuted.

meta.xref: DES s6, KYTS p134

config.text: What does this sign mean?

choices.label: No through road on the left
No entry for traffic turning left

correct.text: This sign shows you that you can't get through to another route by turning left at the junction ahead.

incorrect.text: This sign shows you that you can't get through to another route by turning left at the junction ahead.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p127, KYTS p20

config.text: Which sign shows that you're entering a one-way system?

correct.text: If the road has two lanes, you can use either lane and overtake on either side. Use the lane that's more convenient for your destination unless signs or road markings indicate otherwise.

incorrect.text: If the road has two lanes, you can use either lane and overtake on either side. Use the lane that's more convenient for your destination unless signs or road markings indicate otherwise.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p133, KYTS p134

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: You won't be able to find a through route to another road. Use this road only for access.

incorrect.text: You won't be able to find a through route to another road. Use this road only for access.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p105, KYTS p107

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: Temporary restrictions on motorways are shown on signs that have flashing amber lights. At the end of the restriction, you'll see this sign without any flashing lights.

incorrect.text: Temporary restrictions on motorways are shown on signs that have flashing amber lights. At the end of the restriction, you'll see this sign without any flashing lights.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p122, KYTS p104

config.text: You're on a motorway. What should you do if there's a red cross showing on the signs above your lane only?

choices.label: Continue in that lane and look for further information
Stop and wait for an instruction to proceed

correct.text: A red cross above your lane shows that your lane is closed. You should move into another lane as soon as you can do so safely.

incorrect.text: A red cross above your lane shows that your lane is closed. You should move into another lane as soon as you can do so safely.

meta.xref: DES s6

config.text: How should the right-hand lane of a three-lane motorway be used?

correct.text: You should stay in the left-hand lane of a motorway unless you're overtaking another vehicle. The right-hand lane of a motorway is an overtaking lane; it isn't the 'fast lane'. After overtaking, move back to the left when it's safe to do so.

incorrect.text: You should stay in the left-hand lane of a motorway unless you're overtaking another vehicle. The right-hand lane of a motorway is an overtaking lane; it isn't the 'fast lane'. After overtaking, move back to the left when it's safe to do so.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p9, KYTS p16

config.text: Which type of sign tells you what you must not do?

correct.text: Signs in the shape of a circle give orders. A sign with a red circle means that you aren't allowed to do something. Study Know Your Traffic Signs to ensure that you understand what the different traffic signs mean.

incorrect.text: Signs in the shape of a circle give orders. A sign with a red circle means that you aren't allowed to do something. Study Know Your Traffic Signs to ensure that you understand what the different traffic signs mean.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p10

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: As you approach a roundabout, look well ahead and check all signs. Decide which exit you wish to take and move into the correct position as you approach the roundabout, signalling as required.

incorrect.text: As you approach a roundabout, look well ahead and check all signs. Decide which exit you wish to take and move into the correct position as you approach the roundabout, signalling as required.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p126, KYTS p19

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: The 'no right turn' sign may be used to warn road users that there's a 'no entry' prohibition on a road to the right ahead.

incorrect.text: The 'no right turn' sign may be used to warn road users that there's a 'no entry' prohibition on a road to the right ahead.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p161

config.text: What does this sign mean?

correct.text: You might see this sign where traffic lights are out of order. Proceed with caution, as nobody has priority at the junction.

incorrect.text: You might see this sign where traffic lights are out of order. Proceed with caution, as nobody has priority at the junction.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p128, KYTS p161

config.text: What should you do when you see this sign at a crossroads?

correct.text: When traffic lights are out of order, treat the junction as an unmarked crossroads. Be very careful and be prepared to stop; no-one has priority.

incorrect.text: When traffic lights are out of order, treat the junction as an unmarked crossroads. Be very careful and be prepared to stop; no-one has priority.
